intro: Eclipta sulcata, commonly known as the rough ironweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. Eclipta sulcata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and open woodlands.
